title: TU144: The Case of Feli, an Awkward Goose
description: A poignant short story about isolation to connection. There is hope for us all - no matter your attachment history, there is hope for change with relationships.  In this episode, Sue Marriott LCSW, CGP shares a specific case about an awkward goose named Felicity as another way of looking at change in attachment. Dan Stern's paper linked and recommended. Find more at www.therapistuncensored.com
itunes:subtitle: Overcoming fear to gain connection
itunes:summary: A poignant story about isolation to connection. There is hope for us all - no matter your attachment history, there is hope for change with relationships.  In this episode, Sue Marriott LCSW, CGP shares a specific case about an awkward goose named Felicity as another way of looking at change in attachment. Many people develop strategies to deal with stress that make them awkward in adulthood, don't lose hope! Dan Stern's paper is linked and recommended. Find more at www.therapistuncensored.com
itunes:author: Dan Stern, Sue Marriott
itunes:title: The Case of Feli, an Awkward Goose (for the Awkward Among Us)
